problem.markdown:
>>There are no self-loops in continuous time Markov processes, because in continuous time models...<< [ ] The state constantly changes state, never staying in one state. Therefore self-loops are unnecessary. [x] The system may not change states in a finite time interval, and its remaining in one state is implied by simply not transitioning to another state. [x] The probability of remaining in a state in a finite time interval is simply approximated by 1 - (the sum of the probability densities of all possible transitions multiplied by that time interval)
[explanation] See video 4 (slides 34 - 35). [explanation]
